La oscuridad de la noche parecía haberse vuelto más profunda, como si estuviera reflejando el abismo de su propia mente, y en ese momento, parecía que nada podría interrumpir el torrente de ideas y conexiones que fluían a través de su cerebro con una velocidad y una claridad que eran casi sobrehumanas.

El hombre parecía haberse sumido en un estado de profunda desesperación, como si el peso del mundo hubiera caído sobre sus hombros. Holmes se dio cuenta de que era importante romper el silencio y hacer que el hombre hablara, así que se aclaró la garganta y dijo en voz suave: "¿En qué puedo ayudarlo, señor? ¿Qué lo trae a mi presencia en este estado de angustia?" El hombre levantó la cabeza lentamente, y Holmes pudo ver la desesperación y la desolación reflejadas en sus ojos. "Es mi hija", dijo el hombre con voz temblorosa. "Ha desaparecido. La policía no puede encontrarla, y yo... yo no sé qué hacer". Holmes asintió con la cabeza, comprendiendo la gravedad de la situación, y se dispuso a escuchar atentamente la historia del hombre, decidido a ayudarlo a encontrar a su hija y a descubrir la verdad detrás de su desaparición.

en_first_half: “The man married a woman very much older than himself for her money,” said he, “and he enjoyed the use of the money of the daughter as long as she lived with them. It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it. The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”

As I watched him, I couldn't help but feel a sense of awe at the incredible powers of observation and deduction that lay hidden beneath his calm and composed exterior. The floor creaks beneath one's feet, and the air is thick with the scent of decay and rot. I recall the first time I walked down that corridor, feeling as though I was being led deeper into a labyrinth from which there was no escape. The door to my bedroom was at the far end, and I could feel a chill run down my spine as I pushed it open, the hinges groaning in protest. Inside, the room was small and dimly lit, with a single window that looked out onto the overgrown gardens, the moon casting eerie shadows on the walls. It was there that I spent many sleepless nights, my mind racing with thoughts of the past and the secrets that the manor-house held, secrets that I was determined to uncover, no matter the cost. As I lay in bed, I could hear the wind howling through the empty halls, and the creaks and groans of the old house seemed to take on a menacing tone, as though it too was warning me to leave, to flee from the darkness that lurked within its walls. en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.

I tried to break the silence, to ask him about our destination or the purpose of our journey, but my voice caught in my throat. I tried to break the silence, to ask him about our destination or the purpose of our journey, but my voice caught in my throat. It was as if some unseen force was preventing me from speaking, from asking the questions that were burning in my mind. The only sound was the creaking and groaning of the carriage, the horses' hooves pounding out a rhythmic beat on the rough road. I felt like I was trapped in a nightmare, with no escape from the suffocating darkness that surrounded me. And then, just as suddenly as it had begun, the carriage slowed to a stop. The horses snorted and stamped, their breath misting in the chill night air. Colonel Stark leaned forward, his eyes glinting in the dim light, and spoke for the first time since we had set out. "We're here," he said, his voice low and gravelly. I peered out into the darkness, trying to see where "here" was, but there was nothing to see. Just a vast, empty blackness that seemed to stretch out forever. I felt a shiver run down my spine as Colonel Stark opened the door and stepped out into the night, beckoning me to follow him. I hesitated for a moment, unsure of what lay ahead, but something about his demeanor brooked no argument. I took a deep breath and stepped out into the unknown, the darkness closing in around me like a shroud.

Đại tá Stark dẫn tôi vào trong nhà và chúng tôi đi qua một hành lang dài, rộng với nhiều bức tranh và tượng trang trí trên tường. Chúng tôi cuối cùng đến một phòng lớn với một bàn tròn ở giữa, và Đại tá Stark mời tôi ngồi xuống. Tôi ngồi và nhìn xung quanh, cố gắng hiểu tại sao tôi lại được đưa đến đây. Đại tá Stark ngồi đối diện với tôi và bắt đầu nói: "Tôi đã đưa bạn đến đây vì tôi cần sự giúp đỡ của bạn." Tôi nhìn ông ta và hỏi: "Giúp đỡ về việc gì?" Đại tá Stark nhìn tôi nghiêm túc và nói: "Tôi sẽ giải thích mọi thứ, nhưng trước tiên, bạn cần phải hiểu rằng đây là một việc rất quan trọng và cần sự tuyệt đối bí mật." Tôi gật đầu và nói: "Tôi hiểu, xin hãy nói tiếp." Đại tá Stark bắt đầu giải thích và tôi lắng nghe chăm chú, cố gắng hiểu rõ về việc mình đang tham gia vào gì.
es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."
es_results: cuando el coche se detenía en un bache particularmente grande, el coronel Stark se inclinaba hacia adelante y miraba por el parabrisas con una expresión de concentración. Me pregunté si estaría buscando algo o alguien en particular, pero no pude adivinar qué podría ser. La oscuridad fuera parecía total, y el único sonido era el del motor del coche y el crujido de los neumáticos sobre el pavimento irregular. De repente, el coronel Stark se enderezó y se volvió hacia mí con una sonrisa en el rostro. "Estamos llegando", dijo, su voz baja y suave. "Prepárate". Me pregunté a qué me estaba preparando, pero antes de que pudiera hacer ninguna pregunta, el coche se detuvo bruscamente y el coronel Stark abrió la puerta y salió.

De repente, el coronel Stark se enderezó y se volvió hacia mí con una sonrisa en el rostro. "Estamos llegando", dijo, su voz baja y suave. "Prepárate". Me pregunté a qué me estaba preparando, pero antes de que pudiera hacer ninguna pregunta, el coche se detuvo bruscamente y el coronel Stark abrió la puerta y salió. Me quedé sentado allí durante un momento, mirando a mi alrededor en la oscuridad, tratando de ver algo, pero no había nada. Entonces, oí la voz del coronel Stark llamándome desde fuera, y salí del coche para reunirme con él. Estábamos en un claro pequeño, rodeado de árboles altos y oscuros que parecían cerrarse sobre nosotros como una cortina. En el centro del claro había una casa grande y antigua, con ventanas iluminadas que parecían mirarnos como ojos. El coronel Stark me hizo un gesto para que lo siguiera, y comencé a caminar hacia la casa, sintiendo una sensación de aprensión creciente en mi pecho. ¿Qué era lo que me esperaba allí? ¿Y por qué me había traído el coronel Stark a este lugar remoto y misterioso? Las preguntas se agolpaban en mi mente mientras subía los escalones hacia la puerta principal, que se abrió con un crujido cuando el coronel Stark la empujó. Una figura encorvada y anciana nos recibió en el umbral, con una sonrisa débil en el rostro. "Bienvenido", dijo, su voz temblorosa. "He estado esperando". Y con eso, me hizo un gesto para que entrara, y yo lo seguí, sintiendo que estaba a punto de descubrir un secreto que cambiaría mi vida para siempre.

I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. en_results_raw: on her dark hair, and the sparkle in her eyes, I guessed that she was still young. As she drew nearer, the light from the lamp danced across her features, illuminating the gentle curves of her face and the soft, full lips that seemed to curve into a perpetual smile. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the woman as if seeking guidance or reassurance. She moved towards him, her long skirt rustling softly on the floor, and as she reached his side, she placed a gentle hand on his arm, her touch seeming to calm the agitation that had possessed him. "Welcome, gentlemen," she said, her voice low and melodious, "I see you've arrived. Please, come in, come in." She stepped aside, allowing us to pass, and as we entered the house, the warm glow of the lamp enveloped us, banishing the darkness and uncertainty that had preceded our arrival. The woman's eyes never left ours, her gaze piercing yet kind, as if she could see into the very depths of our souls, and I felt a shiver run down my spine as I met her gaze, sensing that we were in the presence of someone truly extraordinary. As we followed her into the heart of the house, the shadows seemed to recede, and the air grew thick with an almost palpable sense of anticipation, as if the very walls were waiting to see what would unfold.

"Bienvenidos", dijo, "he estado esperándolos. Por favor, pasen y siéntense. Les ofreceré algo de beber después de su largo viaje". Allí, en ese espacio acogedor, comenzamos a sentir que estábamos en un lugar donde el tiempo se detenía, y donde las preocupaciones del mundo exterior parecían desvanecerse. La mujer, cuyo nombre aún no conocíamos, se movía con una gracia silenciosa, preparando todo con una eficiencia que denotaba una práctica larga y dedicada. Mientras tanto, el coronel y yo intercambiamos una mirada, y sin necesidad de palabras, supimos que estábamos pensando lo mismo: que este lugar, y esta mujer, eran algo especial, algo que nos haría olvidar, al menos por un tiempo, las sombras que nos habían llevado hasta allí.
